## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`at`](#at): This class manages /etc/at.allow and /etc/at.deny and the atd service.

### Defined types

* [`at::user`](#atuser): Add the user $name to /etc/at.allow

## Classes

### <a name="at"></a>`at`

This class manages /etc/at.allow and /etc/at.deny and the atd service.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `at` class:

* [`users`](#users)
* [`package_ensure`](#package_ensure)

##### <a name="users"></a>`users`

Data type: `Array[String]`

An array of additional at users, using the defiend type ``at::user``

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="package_ensure"></a>`package_ensure`

Data type: `String`

The value of ``ensure`` for package resources

Default value: `simplib::lookup('simp_options::package_ensure', { 'default_value' => 'installed' })`

## Defined types

### <a name="atuser"></a>`at::user`

Add the user $name to /etc/at.allow

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `at::user` defined type:

* [`name`](#name)

##### <a name="name"></a>`name`

The user to add to /etc/at.allow
